intro: Dialium kunstleri, commonly known as the African cherry or white-leafed satinwood, is a tropical tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by yellow, fleshy berries containing numerous seeds. It is valued for its hard, heavy wood and is often found in moist lowland forests. The plant also has medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
